result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy A Foss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A Foss

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Andy Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 30, 2022.
9:00 AM Case not called on the record, parties signed stipulation and order.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Andy Herbers has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with co-actor (David Rivera) listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

02:40 PM Defendant Jeremy A Foss in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Erick Schlueter.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
